results.title: Black Samson
results.creator_credit: Charles Bail, Daniel B. Cady, Omni Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the more conscientious and political ‘right on’ of the Blaxploitation genre, Charles Bail’s (‘Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of gold’) ‘Black Samson’ stars Rockne Tarkington as Samson, a community minded nightclub owner whose softly spoken voice and peaceful demure doesn’t deter him from sticking it to the ‘man’ when drugs invade his inner city neighbourhood. His saintly like persona is further enhanced by the staff he carries with him everywhere, which also happens to be a deadly weapon when needed. Samson’s patience is tested when the mafia begin to recruit some of the black gangs in his hood to help them distribute drugs in the area. Things get personal however when the mob rough-up his girlfriend in order to dissuade him from interfering with their racket. Naturally all hell breaks loose as Samson bands with his neighbourhood to combat the drug menace and settle his personal score. Cast also includes William Smith, Connie Strickland, Michael Payne and Carol Speed.

results.title: Birthday boy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Gregory and Sejong Park
results.brief_description: Korea 1951 - little Manuk is playing on the streets of his village and dreaming of life at the front where his father is a soldier. He returns home to find a parcel on the doorstep and, thinking it is a birthday present, he opens it. But its contents will change his life.

results.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Guy Trosper, Stuart Millar and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Robert Stroud was sentenced to serve 40 years in solitary confinement in Alcatraz. Nevertheless, he became one of the foremost authorities on birds and their diseases. His fascination and love for birds began when he nursed a sick and injured sparrow back to health. Encouraged in prison by a guard, Stroud developed his interest in birds which was strangely at odds with the harshness of the prison environment. Burt Lancaster gives an excellent performance as Stroud, Karl Malden plays the Warden, Telly Savalas is Stroud’s prison mate, Neville Brand is the prison guard and Thelma Ritter is outstanding as Stroud’s domineering mother.

results.title: Biquefarre
results.creator_credit: William Gilcher, Marie-Francoise Mascaro, Bertrand van Effenterre and Georges Rouquier
results.brief_description:
Georges Rouquier revisits the characters of his 1938 ‘Biquefarre’ 35 year later. The family whose farm was wired for electricity in the first film are still on the family spread in 1983. The plot revolves around Raoul who decides to sell the farm to take up a job as gardener with the City of Toulouse. Though documentary in technique, the film is well planned and scripted, with its amateur cast convincingly mouthing the lines given them by Rouqier.

Credits: Producer, Bertrand van Effenterre, Marie-Francoise Mascaro, William Gilcher ; director, Georges Rouquier ; writers, Georges Rouquier, Maria Signorini ; photography, Andre Villard ; music, Yves Gilbert
Cast: Henri Rouquier, Maria Rouquier, Roger Malet, Roch Rouquier, Raymond Rouquier.

results.title: Billy Madison
results.creator_credit: Tamara Davis, Robert Simonds and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Billy Madison’s future is made, or so he thought. He is heir to his father’s fortune, he’s passed high school compliments of his father’s cheque book, and he spends his days lazing by the pool, drinking and chasing women. His world is thrown into chaos when his father informs him of plans to hand over the family fortune, the Fortune 500 company, to vice president, and resident weasel, Eric Gordon. Billy makes a bet with his father to regain what is rightfully his. The bet is that Billy will go back to school and pass every year level within 24 weeks. Working against him is Eric, determined to retain the company, while working for him is an attractive teacher whose very interested in her new student. Cast includes Adam Sandler, Bradley Whitford, Darren McGavin and Bridgette Wilson.

results.title: Billy Liar
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni, Waterhall Productions and Vic Films
results.brief_description: Billy Fisher lives in the rich and escapist world of his wild imagination. An irresponsible clerk in a north country town, Billy is unable to tell the truth even for two minutes. In his fantasies, Billy is a successful man of the world; in reality he gets into one scrape after another. Unable to communicate with his parents, engaged to two girls at the same time and dreaming of being a writer, Billy’s life becomes almost unbearable. Into this picture enters Liz. Her free spirit and appreciation of the creativity behind the day-dreams, offers Billy the possibility of escape. Tom Courtenay is Billy and Julie Christie is Liz in what is recognised as one of the landmark films of its decade.

results.title: Big Wednesday
results.creator_credit: John Milius, Buzz Feitshans and A-Team Productions
results.brief_description: Set between 1962 and 1974, “Big Wednesday” is the story of three surfing friends - Matt, Jack and Leroy. We see their loves, fights and the hero worship that follows them as they conquer the waves. The South Swell 1962: the three rule the waves. Together with their friends they get drunk, go on surfing holidays and have wild and destructive parties. As the years pass, the Vietnam War and growing up take their toll. They witness the changes in themselves, their home and friends. The Great Swell 1974: Matt, Jack and Leroy re-unite to brave one last journey together, to surf the great swell. “Big Wednesday” encapsulates the emotions of passing youth against the splendour of the sea and surfing. Includes a special appearance by surfing legend, “Mr. Pipeline”, Jerry Lopez. Cast includes: William Katt, Gary Busey, Jan Michael Vincent, Patti D’Arbanville and Lee Purcell.

results.title: Bicentennial man
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe, Neal E. Miller, Gail Katz, Wolfgang Petersen, Radiant Productions, Laurence Mark Productions, 1492 Pictures, Touchstone Pictures and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Starring Robin Williams and Sam Neill, this is a futuristic tale set in the not so distant future when every home will have an NDR-114 robot - the latest technological advancement to serve man. This is the story of one NDR-114 robot, who came off the production line with a unique fault - he doesn’t want to be a robot, and his amazing 200-year journey to become human. Based on the short story and novel “The Positronic man” by Isaac Asimov.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Columbus, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe, Neal E. Miller, Gail Katz, Wolfgang Petersen, Radiant Productions, Laurence Mark Productions, 1492 Pictures, Touchstone Pictures and Columbia Pictures

results.title: Bhowani Junction
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In what is considered by many fans to be her best performance, Ava Gardner stars as the heroine Victoria Jones, a woman forced to make some painful life decisions in post Colonial India. Her relationship with three men; Colonel Savage (Stewart Granger) a British military man in charge of protecting trains crossing Bhowani Junction, fellow Anglo-Indian Patrick Taylor (Bill Travers), and Sikh communist Peter Illing who befriends Victoria after she kills a potential rapist in self defence - challenging her to assess where her loyalties and ethnicity lie. Adapted from the novel by John Masters.

results.title: Beyond Rangoon
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Eric Plestow, Barry Spikings and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Patricia Arquette stars as American doctor Laura Bowman who flees to Burma on a package tour with her sister, Andy (Frances McDormand), following a family tragedy. Rather than achieve the peace and solitude she is desperately searching for, she encounters problems when the clash between peaceful protest and a militant government take an ugly turn. Andy flees the country, but Laura finds herself alone after being separated from her tour group, and without an identity after her passport is stolen at a political rally. She is befriended by a former professor (Aung Ko) who attempts to help her reach the Thailand border, and an allegory is drawn between a young woman’s plight to reach freedom and that of a nation facing political unrest. On their journey they witness firsthand the political struggle encountered by a group of dissidents. Cast also includes Spalding Gray and Victor Slezak.
